headline.print_headline: Doctor Convicted in Outbreak to Undergo Evaluation
headline.main: Doctor Convicted in Outbreak to Undergo Evaluation

docs.snippet: A former Nevada doctor at the center of a 2007 hepatitis C outbreak has been ordered into federal custody for a mental evaluation....
docs.lead_paragraph: A former Nevada doctor at the center of a 2007 hepatitis C outbreak has been ordered into federal custody for a mental evaluation.

headline.sub: Activist: People of Slaviansk want peace
headline.main: Activist: People of Slaviansk want peace

docs.snippet: A day after a deadly shooting in Slaviansk, one activist says they just want peace. Meanwhile, Russia blames Kiev for failing to control extremists. Nathan Frandino reports....
docs.lead_paragraph: A day after a deadly shooting in Slaviansk, one activist says they just want peace. Meanwhile, Russia blames Kiev for failing to control extremists. Nathan Frandino reports.

headline.print_headline: As Army Shrinks, Young Officers Being Pushed Out
headline.main: As Army Shrinks, Young Officers Being Pushed Out

docs.snippet: After the 9/11 attacks, tens of thousands of young men and women joined the military, heading for the rugged mountains of Afghanistan and dusty deserts of Iraq....
docs.lead_paragraph: After the 9/11 attacks, tens of thousands of young men and women joined the military, heading for the rugged mountains of Afghanistan and dusty deserts of Iraq.

headline.print_headline: White House Sets No Deadline for Russia on Ukraine
headline.main: White House Sets No Deadline for Russia on Ukraine

docs.snippet: The White House says the U.S. government is still trying to determine who was responsible for Sunday's deadly shootout in eastern Ukraine and did not specify when Russia would have to meet the terms of a Geneva agreement for containing tensions in...
docs.lead_paragraph: The White House says the U.S. government is still trying to determine who was responsible for Sunday's deadly shootout in eastern Ukraine and did not specify when Russia would have to meet the terms of a Geneva agreement for containing tensions in the former Soviet state.

headline.print_headline: Merrill Sets New $8 Million Bragging Target for Its Top Brokers
headline.main: Merrill Sets New $8 Million Bragging Target for Its Top Brokers

docs.snippet: Merrill Lynch is dangling a new incentive in front of its brokers by creating a "recognition club" for those who bring in $8 million or more a year from clients, more than doubling the top goals set by its securities industry rivals....
docs.lead_paragraph: Merrill Lynch is dangling a new incentive in front of its brokers by creating a "recognition club" for those who bring in $8 million or more a year from clients, more than doubling the top goals set by its securities industry rivals.

headline.print_headline: CBI Loses Members as Opposes Scottish Independence
headline.main: CBI Loses Members as Opposes Scottish Independence

docs.snippet: Three of Scotland's oldest universities have joined an exit from Britain's leading business lobby group after it registered to campaign against Scottish independence, saying they wanted to stay neutral in the increasingly fractious debate....
docs.lead_paragraph: Three of Scotland's oldest universities have joined an exit from Britain's leading business lobby group after it registered to campaign against Scottish independence, saying they wanted to stay neutral in the increasingly fractious debate.

headline.print_headline: Iran to Cut Gasoline Subsidy This Week, in Test of Rouhani's Support
headline.main: Iran to Cut Gasoline Subsidy This Week, in Test of Rouhani's Support

docs.snippet: Iran will start cutting gasoline subsidies this week, an official said on Monday, a move that will test President Hassan Rouhani's public support as higher petrol prices add to inflation in a country already squeezed by economic sanctions....
docs.lead_paragraph: Iran will start cutting gasoline subsidies this week, an official said on Monday, a move that will test President Hassan Rouhani's public support as higher petrol prices add to inflation in a country already squeezed by economic sanctions.

headline.print_headline: ‘Fortress of Solitude’  Is to Be at the Public
headline.main: 'Fortress of Solitude' Musical Among Highlights of New Public Theater Lineup

docs.snippet: A musical based on Jonathan Lethem’s novel “The Fortress of Solitude” will be part of the Public Theater’s 2014-15 schedule....
docs.abstract: A musical based on Jonathan Lethem’s novel “The Fortress of Solitude” will be part of the Public Theater’s 2014-15 schedule.

headline.print_headline: Timberwolves Coach Adelman Retires After 23 Seasons
headline.main: Timberwolves Coach Adelman Retires After 23 Seasons

docs.snippet: Minnesota Timberwolves head coach Rick Adelman announced his retirement from coaching in the NBA on Monday after 23 seasons in the league calling the shots for five different teams....
docs.lead_paragraph: Minnesota Timberwolves head coach Rick Adelman announced his retirement from coaching in the NBA on Monday after 23 seasons in the league calling the shots for five different teams.

headline.print_headline: Militants Kill Three Before Voting in India's Kashmir
headline.main: Militants Kill Three Before Voting in India's Kashmir

docs.snippet: Militants killed three men in India's restive Kashmir region on Monday, police said, in attacks that appeared intended to intimidate locals who are due to vote in a general election this week....
docs.lead_paragraph: Militants killed three men in India's restive Kashmir region on Monday, police said, in attacks that appeared intended to intimidate locals who are due to vote in a general election this week.
